name: SKKeyframeSequence
desc: An object that performs interpolation between values specified at different times (keyframes).

items.name: init(keyframeValues: [Any], times: [NSNumber])
items.desc: Initializes a keyframe sequence with an initial set of values and times.

items.name: func addKeyframeValue(Any, time: CGFloat)
items.desc: Adds a keyframe to the sequence.

items.name: func removeKeyframe(at: Int)
items.desc: Removes a keyframe from the sequence.

items.name: func removeLastKeyframe()
items.desc: Removes the last value in the sequence.

items.name: func setKeyframeTime(CGFloat, for: Int)
items.desc: Changes the time for a specific keyframe.

items.name: func setKeyframeValue(Any, for: Int)
items.desc: Changes the value for a specific keyframe.

items.name: func setKeyframeValue(Any, time: CGFloat, for: Int)
items.desc: Replaces a keyframe in the sequence with a new keyframe.

items.name: func sample(atTime: CGFloat) -> Any?
items.desc: Calculates the sample at a particular time.

items.name: func count() -> Int
items.desc: The number of keyframes in the sequence.

items.name: func getKeyframeTime(for: Int) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Gets the time for a keyframe in the sequence.

items.name: func getKeyframeValue(for: Int) -> Any
items.desc: Gets the value for a keyframe in the sequence.

items.name: var interpolationMode: SKInterpolationMode
items.desc: The mode used to determine how values for times between the keyframes are calculated.

items.name: var repeatMode: SKRepeatMode
items.desc: The mode used to determine how the keyframe sequence repeats.

items.name: enum SKInterpolationMode
items.desc: The modes used to interpolate between keyframes in the sequence.

items.name: enum SKRepeatMode
items.desc: The modes used to determine how the sequence repeats.
